wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Sidney Mitty MBE (7 May 1919 – 30 September 2007) was a British salesman and the man who turned the first Oxfam gift shop into a national retail network of shops selling second hand clothing and other goods. This network put Oxfam on the high street map and has contributed substantially to Oxfam's income as well as presence in the public eye over the years. It was also an inspiration for many charities to follow Oxfam's lead.Mitty worked for Oxfam for 33 years, earned the nickname of "salesman of the angels".By 2007, there were over 700 Oxfam shops throughout the UK.

response: * 30 September – Joe Mitty, entrepreneur and co-founder of Oxfam (born 1919)
** Joe Mitty, entrepreneur and co-founder of Oxfam (died 2007)
*Joe Mitty, a British salesman and founder of the first Oxfam charity shop in the United Kingdom in 1949
*Joe Mitty, 88, British founder of the Oxfam charity shop.

Oxfam's first paid employee was Joe Mitty, who began working at the Oxfam shop on Broad Street, Oxford on 9 November 1949. Engaged to manage the accounts and distribute donated clothing, he originated the policy of selling anything which people were willing to donate, and developed the shop into a national chain.
